wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier John James Hope Simpson,  (10 October 1927 – 7 March 2007) was a British Army officer who served as Director SAS from 1972 to 1975.

response: Patrols within Malaysia were supplied while in the field by RN Wessex and RAF Whirlwind helicopters, initially dropping supplies to the patrols from low level, and later after the patrols had cleared a landing area in the dense jungle, by landing. A test Joint Service deployment of a Westland SR.N5 hovercraft at Tawau was also trialled under Major John Simpson.
